nodes.bodyText: For current scheduler principal, a tablet can only have one task running or pending at most. So we should delete the cache as soon as possible. It is better to change this function to getAndDeleteCachedSrcBackendId. And call it after scheduler cancelled, task running cancelled, and deleteSrcReplicaOfLB.

I prefer that cache should be managed by Rebalancer, no need to make getCachedSrcBackendId to delete. You can do whatever you want, e.g. only clear cache when stats update.
About cancellations(scheduler canceled, task running cancelled, etc.):
Before these cancellations, adding tablet to the scheduler may get failed. And after the clone task completed, the rest of a rebalance move may get failed too. So there're so many places that need to delete cache. I think we shouldn't 'delete the cache asap'. Maybe clearing cache when stats update is better.
For a  general balance interface.  method name getCachedSrcBackendId is not very clear.   delete the replica of a specified be in  getCachedSrcBackendId is also strange.

It does seem odd, I'll reconsider the naming.
And it's better to use replicaId than use backendId. That'll be clear.

* 3. getSrcReplicaId: if the rebalance strategy wants to delete the src replica,
 * override this func.

Do a delete operation in a get method, I still think which is confusing.
For a balance, the core strategy is how to choose which tablet, choose src backend, choose dest backend. But I don't see the interface about how to choose dest backend.

nodes.bodyText:
Choosing dest be can be done before generating a clone task in createBalanceTask. The base class doesn't limit it.
For example:
The origin rebalance algo: selectAlternativeTablets just select a tablet, choose dest be in createBalanceTask
The algo which has a concrete move: selectAlternativeTablets will select a tablet and src be, dest be. In createBalanceTask, we should check the validation.
